004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
009import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.DataLog;
010import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.IntegerLogEntry;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.StringLogEntry;
012import java.io.File;
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.nio.file.Files;
015import java.nio.file.Path;
016import java.nio.file.Paths;
017import java.time.LocalDateTime;
018import java.time.ZoneId;
019import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
020import java.util.Arrays;
021import java.util.Comparator;
022import java.util.Random;
023
024/**
025 * Centralized data log that provides automatic data log file management. It automatically cleans up
026 * old files when disk space is low and renames the file based either on current date/time or (if
027 * available) competition match number. The deta file will be saved to a USB flash drive if one is
028 * attached, or to /home/lvuser otherwise.
029 *
030 * <p>Log files are initially named "FRC_TBD_{random}.wpilog" until the DS connects. After the DS
031 * connects, the log file is renamed to "FRC_yyyyMMdd_HHmmss.wpilog" (where the date/time is UTC).
032 * If the FMS is connected and provides a match number, the log file is renamed to
033 * "FRC_yyyyMMdd_HHmmss_{event}_{match}.wpilog".
034 *
035 * <p>On startup, all existing FRC_TBD log files are deleted. If there is less than 50 MB of free
036 * space on the target storage, FRC_ log files are deleted (oldest to newest) until there is 50 MB
037 * free OR there are 10 files remaining.
038 *
039 * <p>By default, all NetworkTables value changes are stored to the data log.
040 */
041public final class DataLogManager {
042  private static DataLog m_log;
043  private static String m_logDir;
044  private static boolean m_filenameOverride;
045  private static final Thread m_thread;
046  private static final ZoneId m_utc = ZoneId.of("UTC");
047  private static final DateTimeFormatter m_timeFormatter =
048      DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyyMMdd_HHmmss").withZone(m_utc);
049  private static boolean m_ntLoggerEnabled = true;
050  private static int m_ntEntryLogger;
051  private static int m_ntConnLogger;
052  private static StringLogEntry m_messageLog;
053
054  // if less than this much free space, delete log files until there is this much free space
055  // OR there are this many files remaining.
056  private static final long kFreeSpaceThreshold = 50000000L;
057  private static final int kFileCountThreshold = 10;
058
059  private DataLogManager() {}
060
061  static {
062    m_thread = new Thread(DataLogManager::logMain, "DataLogDS");
063    m_thread.setDaemon(true);
064  }
065
066  /** Start data log manager with default directory location. */
067  public static synchronized void start() {
068    start("", "", 0.25);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Start data log manager. The parameters have no effect if the data log manager was already
073   * started (e.g. by calling another static function).
074   *
075   * @param dir if not empty, directory to use for data log storage
076   */
077  public static synchronized void start(String dir) {
078    start(dir, "", 0.25);
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Start data log manager. The parameters have no effect if the data log manager was already
083   * started (e.g. by calling another static function).
084   *
085   * @param dir if not empty, directory to use for data log storage
086   * @param filename filename to use; if none provided, the filename is automatically generated
087   */
088  public static synchronized void start(String dir, String filename) {
089    start(dir, filename, 0.25);
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Start data log manager. The parameters have no effect if the data log manager was already
094   * started (e.g. by calling another static function).
095   *
096   * @param dir if not empty, directory to use for data log storage
097   * @param filename filename to use; if none provided, the filename is automatically generated
098   * @param period time between automatic flushes to disk, in seconds; this is a time/storage
099   *     tradeoff
100   */
101  public static synchronized void start(String dir, String filename, double period) {
102    if (m_log != null) {
103      return;
104    }
105    m_logDir = makeLogDir(dir);
106    m_filenameOverride = !filename.isEmpty();
107
108    // Delete all previously existing FRC_TBD_*.wpilog files. These only exist when the robot
109    // never connects to the DS, so they are very unlikely to have useful data and just clutter
110    // the filesystem.
111    File[] files =
112        new File(m_logDir)
113            .listFiles((d, name) -> name.startsWith("FRC_TBD_") && name.endsWith(".wpilog"));
114    if (files != null) {
115      for (File file : files) {
116        if (!file.delete()) {
117          System.err.println("DataLogManager: could not delete " + file);
118        }
119      }
120    }
121
122    m_log = new DataLog(m_logDir, makeLogFilename(filename), period);
123    m_messageLog = new StringLogEntry(m_log, "messages");
124    m_thread.start();
125
126    // Log all NT entries and connections
127    if (m_ntLoggerEnabled) {
128      startNtLog();
129    }
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Log a message to the "messages" entry. The message is also printed to standard output (followed
134   * by a newline).
135   *
136   * @param message message
137   */
138  public static synchronized void log(String message) {
139    if (m_messageLog == null) {
140      start();
141    }
142    m_messageLog.append(message);
143    System.out.println(message);
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Get the managed data log (for custom logging). Starts the data log manager if not already
148   * started.
149   *
150   * @return data log
151   */
152  public static synchronized DataLog getLog() {
153    if (m_log == null) {
154      start();
155    }
156    return m_log;
157  }
158
159  /**
160   * Get the log directory.
161   *
162   * @return log directory, or empty string if logging not yet started
163   */
164  public static synchronized String getLogDir() {
165    if (m_logDir == null) {
166      return "";
167    }
168    return m_logDir;
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Enable or disable logging of NetworkTables data. Note that unlike the network interface for
173   * NetworkTables, this will capture every value change. Defaults to enabled.
174   *
175   * @param enabled true to enable, false to disable
176   */
177  public static synchronized void logNetworkTables(boolean enabled) {
178    boolean wasEnabled = m_ntLoggerEnabled;
179    m_ntLoggerEnabled = enabled;
180    if (m_log == null) {
181      start();
182      return;
183    }
184    if (enabled && !wasEnabled) {
185      startNtLog();
186    } else if (!enabled && wasEnabled) {
187      stopNtLog();
188    }
189  }
190
191  private static String makeLogDir(String dir) {
192    if (!dir.isEmpty()) {
193      return dir;
194    }
195
196    if (RobotBase.isReal()) {
197      try {
198        // prefer a mounted USB drive if one is accessible
199        Path usbDir = Paths.get("/u").toRealPath();
200        if (Files.isWritable(usbDir)) {
201          return usbDir.toString();
202        }
203      } catch (IOException ex) {
204        // ignored
205      }
206    }
207
208    return Filesystem.getOperatingDirectory().getAbsolutePath();
209  }
210
211  private static String makeLogFilename(String filenameOverride) {
212    if (!filenameOverride.isEmpty()) {
213      return filenameOverride;
214    }
215    Random rnd = new Random();
216    StringBuilder filename = new StringBuilder();
217    filename.append("FRC_TBD_");
218    for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
219      filename.append(String.format("%04x", rnd.nextInt(0x10000)));
220    }
221    filename.append(".wpilog");
222    return filename.toString();
223  }
224
225  private static void startNtLog() {
226    NetworkTableInstance inst = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault();
227    m_ntEntryLogger = inst.startEntryDataLog(m_log, "", "NT:");
228    m_ntConnLogger = inst.startConnectionDataLog(m_log, "NTConnection");
229  }
230
231  private static void stopNtLog() {
232    NetworkTableInstance.stopEntryDataLog(m_ntEntryLogger);
233    NetworkTableInstance.stopConnectionDataLog(m_ntConnLogger);
234  }
235
236  private static void logMain() {
237    // based on free disk space, scan for "old" FRC_*.wpilog files and remove
238    {
239      File logDir = new File(m_logDir);
240      long freeSpace = logDir.getFreeSpace();
241      if (freeSpace < kFreeSpaceThreshold) {
242        // Delete oldest FRC_*.wpilog files (ignore FRC_TBD_*.wpilog as we just created one)
243        File[] files =
244            logDir.listFiles(
245                (dir, name) ->
246                    name.startsWith("FRC_")
247                        && name.endsWith(".wpilog")
248                        && !name.startsWith("FRC_TBD_"));
249        if (files != null) {
250          Arrays.sort(files, Comparator.comparingLong(File::lastModified));
251          int count = files.length;
252          for (File file : files) {
253            --count;
254            if (count < kFileCountThreshold) {
255              break;
256            }
257            long length = file.length();
258            if (file.delete()) {
259              freeSpace += length;
260              if (freeSpace >= kFreeSpaceThreshold) {
261                break;
262              }
263            } else {
264              System.err.println("DataLogManager: could not delete " + file);
265            }
266          }
267        }
268      }
269    }
270
271    int timeoutCount = 0;
272    boolean paused = false;
273    int dsAttachCount = 0;
274    int fmsAttachCount = 0;
275    boolean dsRenamed = m_filenameOverride;
276    boolean fmsRenamed = m_filenameOverride;
277    int sysTimeCount = 0;
278    IntegerLogEntry sysTimeEntry =
279        new IntegerLogEntry(
280            m_log, "systemTime", "{\"source\":\"DataLogManager\",\"format\":\"time_t_us\"}");
281
282    while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
283      boolean newData = DriverStation.waitForData(0.25);
284      if (Thread.interrupted()) {
285        break;
286      }
287      if (!newData) {
288        timeoutCount++;
289        // pause logging after being disconnected for 10 seconds
290        if (timeoutCount > 40 && !paused) {
291          timeoutCount = 0;
292          paused = true;
293          m_log.pause();
294        }
295        continue;
296      }
297      // when we connect to the DS, resume logging
298      timeoutCount = 0;
299      if (paused) {
300        paused = false;
301        m_log.resume();
302      }
303
304      if (!dsRenamed) {
305        // track DS attach
306        if (DriverStation.isDSAttached()) {
307          dsAttachCount++;
308        } else {
309          dsAttachCount = 0;
310        }
311        if (dsAttachCount > 50) { // 1 second
312          LocalDateTime now = LocalDateTime.now(m_utc);
313          if (now.getYear() > 2000) {
314            // assume local clock is now synchronized to DS, so rename based on
315            // local time
316            m_log.setFilename("FRC_" + m_timeFormatter.format(now) + ".wpilog");
317            dsRenamed = true;
318          } else {
319            dsAttachCount = 0; // wait a bit and try again
320          }
321        }
322      }
323
324      if (!fmsRenamed) {
325        // track FMS attach
326        if (DriverStation.isFMSAttached()) {
327          fmsAttachCount++;
328        } else {
329          fmsAttachCount = 0;
330        }
331        if (fmsAttachCount > 100) { // 2 seconds
332          // match info comes through TCP, so we need to double-check we've
333          // actually received it
334          DriverStation.MatchType matchType = DriverStation.getMatchType();
335          if (matchType != DriverStation.MatchType.None) {
336            // rename per match info
337            char matchTypeChar;
338            switch (matchType) {
339              case Practice:
340                matchTypeChar = 'P';
341                break;
342              case Qualification:
343                matchTypeChar = 'Q';
344                break;
345              case Elimination:
346                matchTypeChar = 'E';
347                break;
348              default:
349                matchTypeChar = '_';
350                break;
351            }
352            m_log.setFilename(
353                "FRC_"
354                    + m_timeFormatter.format(LocalDateTime.now(m_utc))
355                    + "_"
356                    + DriverStation.getEventName()
357                    + "_"
358                    + matchTypeChar
359                    + DriverStation.getMatchNumber()
360                    + ".wpilog");
361            fmsRenamed = true;
362            dsRenamed = true; // don't override FMS rename
363          }
364        }
365      }
366
367      // Write system time every ~5 seconds
368      sysTimeCount++;
369      if (sysTimeCount >= 250) {
370        sysTimeCount = 0;
371        sysTimeEntry.append(WPIUtilJNI.getSystemTime(), WPIUtilJNI.now());
372      }
373    }
374  }
375}
